summary_points: 1.  As of August 31, 2025, FedEx repurchased 2.2 million shares of its common stock for a total of $500 million under its 2024 stock repurchase program.
2.  Credit losses were $219 million for the three months ended August 31, 2025, a significant increase from $129 million during the same period in 2024.

3.  FedEx has $1.6 billion remaining available for stock repurchases under its 2024 program as of August 31, 2025, and has also entered into additional, yet-to-commence leases with undiscounted future payments of approximately $1 billion.
1. Philip Morris International Inc. (PMI) increased its regular quarterly dividend by 8.9% to $1.47 per share, payable on October 20, 2025.
2. As of June 30, 2025, PMI's smoke-free products were available in 97 markets and used by over 41 million legal-age consumers, accounting for 41% of its first-half 2025 net revenues.
3. PMI has invested over $14 billion since 2008 to develop smoke-free products and aims to completely end cigarette sales.
1. SCE settled a claim for $2.0 billion related to 2018 Woolsey Fire losses, representing 35% of the initially claimed $5.6 billion.
2.  Full recovery of the settlement amount is contingent upon CPUC approval of a securitization application by the end of 2026; otherwise, recovery will occur through rate increases over five years.
3.  The settlement concludes on September 19, 2025.
1. Align Technology, Inc. terminated the employment of Stuart Hockridge, Executive Vice President, Global Human Resources, effective May 2026.
2. The termination of Mr. Hockridge's employment was not for cause, as defined in his employment agreement.
3.  Any severance payments to Mr. Hockridge will be consistent with his employment agreement and the company's 2025 Proxy Statement.

1. On September 17, 2025, IDEX Corporation's Board of Directors authorized a $635 million increase to its common share repurchase program, resulting in a total authorized repurchase availability of approximately $1 billion.
2.  As of June 30, 2025, IDEX Corporation had approximately $440 million remaining under its previously approved share repurchase authorizations.
3. IDEX Corporation expects to return at least 70% of its 2025 free cash flow to shareholders through dividends and share repurchases.

1. CenterPoint Energy Inc. commenced cash tender offers on September 18, 2025, for up to $500,000,000 aggregate purchase price (excluding accrued interest) of its and its subsidiary's outstanding securities to reduce indebtedness.
2. The tender offers include up to $300,000,000 of CenterPoint Energy Notes and up to $200,000,000 of CEHE Bonds, with specific acceptance priorities outlined for each security.
3.  The tender offers are expected to be consummated using CenterPoint Energy's cash on hand and borrowings under its commercial paper program, with settlement dates expected in early October 2025.
1. On September 18, 2025, Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. (ICE) appointed The Rt. Hon. the Lord Hill of Oareford CBE as a director, increasing the board size from 10 to 11 members.

2. Lord Hill received aggregate payments of £90,000 (excluding VAT) from ICE Futures Europe from January 1, 2025, to September 18, 2025, under a consultancy agreement that was terminated upon his appointment.
3.  Due to payments exceeding $120,000 from ICE Futures Europe to Lord Hill in 2024, he is not currently considered an independent director.
1. On September 16, 2025, Phillips 66 Company issued $2,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of junior subordinated notes due 2056, fully guaranteed by Phillips 66.
2.  The notes carry interest rates of 5.875% and 6.200% for the initial period, with future interest rates to be reset based on the five-year U.S. Treasury rate plus a spread.
3. The company has the option to defer interest payments for up to 10 consecutive years, although this right is subject to certain restrictions on dividend payments and debt issuances.
1. On September 17, 2025, United Parcel Service, Inc. terminated its planned acquisition of Estafeta due to unmet closing conditions.
2.  No meaningful numerical comparisons are provided in this 8-K filing.
3. This terminated acquisition presents a risk of lost potential revenue and market share, but the specific financial impact is not quantified in this filing.

1. On September 17, 2025, Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. subsidiary NCLC completed a private offering of $2,031.1 million in senior notes, using the proceeds to repurchase and redeem existing debt.
2.  Approximately 90.3% of the outstanding 2027 notes and 97.5% of the outstanding 2026 notes were tendered in a tender offer that expired September 12, 2025.

3. The 2031 and 2033 notes issued have covenants limiting NCLC's ability to create liens on assets, engage in sale-leaseback transactions, and dispose of substantially all assets; a change of control could trigger a repurchase offer at 101% of principal plus interest.
1. Olivier Puech, Executive Vice President and President, International, will retire from American Tower Corporation on January 2, 2026.
2. On September 18, 2025, the company declared a $1.70 per share cash distribution payable October 20, 2025.
3.  The SEC filing, dated September 18, 2025, reports no unusual events or significant financial changes beyond the announced dividend and executive retirement.
1. FedEx reported year-over-year earnings growth for the first quarter ended August 31, 2025, with diluted EPS increasing from $3.21 to $3.46 (GAAP) and $3.60 to $3.83 (non-GAAP).
2.  FedEx completed a $500 million share repurchase program during the first quarter of fiscal year 2026, leaving $1.6 billion remaining under its 2024 authorization as of August 31, 2025.

3. FedEx forecasts 4% to 6% revenue growth year over year for fiscal year 2026, with diluted earnings per share projected to be between $14.20 and $16.00 before adjustments and between $17.20 and $19.00 after excluding certain costs, and an effective tax rate of approximately 25% before adjustments.
1. On September 15, 2025, Intel Corp. entered into a securities purchase agreement with NVIDIA Corp., resulting in NVIDIA purchasing 214,776,632 shares of Intel's common stock for $5.0 billion.
2. This represents a significant investment by NVIDIA in Intel, with NVIDIA acquiring 5.0 Billion USD in Intel shares.

3. The agreement includes a collaboration between Intel and NVIDIA to develop AI infrastructure and personal computing products, though future impacts and risks associated with this collaboration remain uncertain as of September 19, 2025.
1. Felicia Williams retired from Paycom Software, Inc.'s Board of Directors on September 30, 2025, reducing the board size from eight to seven directors.
2.  The 8-K filing on September 16, 2025, reports the departure of a director, Felicia Williams, with no stated disagreements with the company.
3. Frederick C. Peters II assumed the role of chairperson of the audit committee following Ms. Williams' retirement, effective September 30, 2025.
1. Texas Instruments Inc. announced a 4% increase to its quarterly cash dividend, raising it from $1.36 to $1.42 per share, as of September 18, 2025.
2. This marks the 22nd consecutive year of dividend increases by the company.
3. The company's future dividend payments are contingent upon formal board declaration in October 2025.
